data.title: The Crypto Industry Must Evolve to Match Real-World Security Risks
data.metadata: Security issues like data breaches and phishing attacks are a type of feedback for Web3 designers, argues Tools for Humanity’s Adrian Ludwig.

data.title: Digital Asset Treasuries: Bitcoin’s Institutional Test Case
data.metadata: Digital Asset Treasuries (DATs) are the first laboratories testing how a decentralised asset can operate as productive capital within the architecture of corporate finance, argues Sygnum Bank CIO Fabian Dori.

data.title: A ‘Skinny’ Fed Master Account Could Bring Back Narrow Banking
data.metadata: Fed Governor Chris Waller’s payments account proposal would let the private sector innovate at the front end and keep the Fed as the trusted settlement layer behind it, argues Digital Self Labs’ Linda Jeng.

data.title: Centralized Exchanges Are Still Criminals’ Favorite Crypto Money Laundering Tool
It’s Time for the Crypto Industry to Take the Threat of AI and Quantum Computing Seriously
Will Interest Payments Make Stablecoins More Interesting?
Bitcoin Climbs to $111K as Whipsaw Action in Crypto Continues
Institutions Drive CME Crypto Options to $9B as ETH, SOL, XRP Set Records
Binance's CZ Wins Pardon From U.S. President Donald Trump
Revolut Secures MiCA License in Cyprus, Expanding Regulated Crypto Services Across EU
Your Company's Balance Sheet is Doomed Without Bitcoin
data.metadata: The traditional corporate playbook risks not only underperformance, but a breach of fiduciary duty as cash reserves bleed away on the altar of money-printing, argues Musqet founder David Parkinson.

data.title: Bitcoin Treasuries Need an Onchain Strategy
data.metadata: Treasury companies that support Bitcoin-native infrastructure development early can gain an edge in an increasingly competitive market, argues Ark Labs’ Alex Bergeron.

data.title: Bitcoin Treasury Companies Should Lean Into the Lightning Network
data.metadata: If you manage a Bitcoin treasury, now is the moment to shift from passive reserve to active participant in the Bitcoin economy, argues Voltage’s Bobby Shell.

data.title: Tether and Circle’s Dominance Is Being Put to the Test
data.metadata: The dominance of Tether and Circle, once seen as unshakable, is now facing its most formidable test yet, crypto product and strategy professional James Murrell argues.

data.title: There Is Too Much Friction in Web3 For Newcomers. Here’s How We Fix it.
data.metadata: The promise of a seamless digital economy is being sabotaged by a simple, recurring nightmare: network switching, says ZetaChain core contributor Jonathan Covey.
